abstract: Two-year federal investigation finds 83 percent of New York City's public elementary schools are not accessible to children with disabilities, violating Americans With Disabilities Act; letter from office of United States Atty Preet Bharara lists minimum changes necessary to remedy violations.
lead_paragraph: Eighty-three percent of the facilities are not “fully accessible” to people with disabilities and six districts do not have a single fully accessible school, a federal investigation found.

headline.main: Most New York City Elementary Schools Are Violating Disabilities Act, Investigation Finds
headline.print_headline: City Faulted for Flouting Disabilities Law at Public Elementary Schools

snippet: Eighty-three percent of the facilities are not “fully accessible” to people with disabilities and six districts do not have a single fully accessible school, a federal investigation found.
